isis.stitle: CF 500, CF 600 - Electrical - Module Communications Network - Diagnosis and Testing

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Wiring Diagrams for schematic and connector information.

svcsubproc.title: Principles of Operation - Module Communications Network
svcsubproc.para: The vehicle has 3 module communications networks:
The diagnostic tool connects to the communications networks through either the data link connector (DLC) or the 9-pin Deutsch connector.

The (CAN) J1939 has an unshielded twisted pair cable, data plus circuit 1851 (WH/LG) and data minus circuit 1852 (PK/LG). This communications network is used for the instrument cluster, engine control module (ECM) and the transmission control module (TCM).

The (CAN) J2284 has an unshielded twisted pair cable, data plus circuit 1814 (WH/LB) and data minus circuit 1815 (PK/LB). This communications network is used for the anti-lock brake system (ABS) module and the instrument cluster.

The CAN networks remain operational, even with the severing of one of the CAN circuits, but operate at a degraded level. Communications also continue at a degraded level if one of the CAN circuits are shorted to ground or voltage, or if some but not all termination resistors are lost.

The (ATA) J1587/J1708 has an unshielded twisted pair cable, data plus circuit 914 (TN/OG) and data minus circuit 915 (PK/LB). The ATA communications network is used for the engine control module (ECM) and the injector drive module (IDM).

svcsubproc.title: Inspection and Verification - Module Communications Network

step1.para: Visually inspect the following for obvious signs of mechanical or electrical damage.

If no obvious cause of the concern is found during the inspection, connect the diagnostic tool to the DLC or the Deutsch diagnostic connector. Attempt to communicate with the module in question. If the diagnostic tool still does not communicate with the module, GO to Symptom Chart.
If no response from the diagnostic tool, GO to Pinpoint Test C for DLC or GO to Pinpoint Test D for Deutsch diagnostic connector.

entry.para: DTCs that start with a "U" are faults which occur during module-to-module communication.
Modules should never be replaced based only on a "U" code. These codes do not always indicate a problem and can be caused by normal diagnostic functions carried out on the vehicle.
CAN Communication Bus Fault - Receive Error
CLEAR the DTCs and REPEAT the self-test. If DTC re-appears, GO to Pinpoint Test A.
CLEAR the DTCs and REPEAT the self-test. If DTC re-appears, GO to Pinpoint Test A.
CLEAR the DTCs and REPEAT the self-test. If DTC re-appears, GO to Pinpoint Test B.
No module/network communication - ECM, TCM, IDM or instrument cluster

item.para: Worn or damaged Deutsch diagnostic connector.

entry.para: No module/network communication - no power to the diagnostic tool at the DLC or Deutsch connector

item.para: Worn or damaged DLC or Deutsch diagnostic connector.

entry.para: For DLC, Go to Pinpoint Test C.
For Deutsch diagnostic connector, Go to Pinpoint Test D.

svcsubproc.title: Pinpoint Tests - Module Communications Network

para.emph: Pinpoint Test A: No Module/Network Communication - ABS

svcsubproc.para: The ABS module is powered through power distribution center fuse 20 (60A), circuit 601 (LB/PK) and communicates through the CAN J2284 network circuits 1814 (WH/LB) and 1815 (PK/LB). If one of the bus wires becomes shorted to ground or voltage, or if some but not all termination resistors are lost, communications can continue at a degraded level. The instrument cluster serves as a communications network gateway between the ABS (CAN J2284) and ECM (CAN J1939).

item.para: Circuits 1814 (WH/LB) or 1815 (PK/LB), shorted to ground or open

table.title: PINPOINT TEST A: NO MODULE/NETWORK COMMUNICATION - ABS

para.emph: A1 CHECK FOR SHORT TO BATTERY ON DIAGNOSTIC LINK

item.para: Measure the voltage at DLC connector C251-6, circuit 1814 (WH/LB) and C251-14, circuit 1815 (PK/LB).

para.emph: Is the voltage at battery voltage present?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A2 CHECK FOR SHORT TO GROUND ON DIAGNOSTIC LINK

item.para: Measure the resistance to ground at DLC connector C251-6, circuit 1814 (WH/LB) and C251-14, circuit 1815 (PK/LB).

para.emph: Is the resistance greater than 10,000 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A3 TEST CONTINUITY OF THE ABS DIAGNOSTIC LINK

item.para: Measure the resistance between ABS C135-3, circuit 1814 (WH/LB) and DLC C251-6, circuit 1814 (WH/LB).
Measure the resistance between ABS C135-18, circuit 1815 (PK/LB) and DLC C251-14, circuit 1815 (PK/LB).

para.emph: Is the resistance more than 5 ohms for either measurement?

entry.para: REPAIR circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: A4 CHECK FOR CORRECT MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Connect all the module connectors and make sure they seat correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new ABS module. Refer to Anti-Lock Control in S04049. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. CLEAR the diagnostic trouble codes (DTCs). REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test B: No Module/Network Communication - ECM, TCM, IDM Or Instrument Cluster

svcsubproc.para: The ECM and IDM modules communicate through the ATA J1708 network through circuits 914 (TN/OG)/832 (LB/PK) and 915 (PK/LB)/830 (TN). If one of the ATA bus wires becomes open, shorted to ground or voltage, ATA network communication is no longer possible. The ECM, TCM and instrument cluster modules communicate through the CAN J1939 network through circuits 1851 (WH/LG) and 1852 (PK/LG). If one of the bus wires becomes shorted to ground or voltage, communications can continue at a degraded level.

item.para: Circuits 1814 (WH/LB) or 1815 (PK/LB), shorted to ground or open
Circuits 914 (TN/OG)/832 (LB/PK) or 915 (PK/LB)/830 (TN), shorted to ground or open

table.title: PINPOINT TEST B: NO MODULE/NETWORK COMMUNICATION - ECM, TCM, IDM OR INSTRUMENT CLUSTER

para.emph: B1 CHECK FOR A SHORT TO BATTERY ON THE DIAGNOSTIC LINK

item.para: Measure the voltage at engine diagnostic connector C2173-F, circuit 914 (TN/OG) and C2173-G, circuit 915 (PK/LB).
Measure the voltage at engine diagnostic connector C2173-C, circuit 1851 (WH/LG) and C2173-D, circuit 1852 (PK/LG).

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts on either measurement?

entry.para: REPAIR the short to battery. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B2 CHECK FOR A SHORT TO GROUND ON THE DIAGNOSTIC LINK

item.para: Measure the resistance to ground at engine diagnostic connector C2173-F, circuit 914 (TN/OG) and C2173-G, circuit 915 (PK/LB).
Measure the resistance to ground at engine diagnostic connector C2173-C, circuit 1851 (WH/LG) and C2173-D, circuit 1852 (PK/LG).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the short to ground on the diagnostic link. TEST the system for normal operation.
For instrument cluster, GO to B6.

para.emph: B3 CHECK THE CONTINUITY OF THE ECM DIAGNOSTIC LINK

item.para: Measure the resistance between ECM C175a-20, circuit 914 (TN/OG) and engine diagnostic connector C2173-F, circuit 914 (TN/OG); and measure the resistance between ECM C175a-21, circuit 915 (PK/LB) and engine diagnostic C2173-G, circuit 915 (PK/LB).

Measure the resistance between ECM C175b-12, circuit 1851 (WH/LG) and engine diagnostic C2173-C, circuit 1851 (WH/LG); and measure the resistance between ECM C175b-13, circuit 1852 (PK/LG) and engine diagnostic C2173-D, circuit 1852 (PK/LG).

para.emph: Is the resistance more than 5 ohms for any measurement?

entry.para: REPAIR the high resistance concern on the affected circuit.

para.emph: B4 CHECK THE CONTINUITY OF THE TCM DIAGNOSTIC LINK

item.para: Measure the resistance between TCM C168-9, circuit 1851 (WH/LG) and engine diagnostic connector C2173-C, circuit 1851 (WH/LG)
Measure the resistance between TCM C168-8, circuit 1852 (PK/LG) and engine diagnostic connector C2173-D, circuit 1852 (PK/LG).

para.emph: Is the resistance greater than 5 ohms for either circuit?

entry.para: REPAIR the high resistance concern on the affected circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B5 TEST THE CONTINUITY OF THE IDM DIAGNOSTIC LINK

item.para: Measure the resistance between IDM C1174c-28, circuit 832 (LB/PK) and engine diagnostic connector C2173-F, circuit 914 (TN/OG).
Measure the resistance between IDM C1174c-29, circuit 830 (TN) and engine diagnostic connector C2173-G, circuit 915 (PK/LB).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms for both measurements?

entry.para: REPAIR the high resistance in the diagnostic link. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B6 TEST THE CONTINUITY OF THE INSTRUMENT CLUSTER DIAGNOSTIC LINK

item.para: Measure the resistance between instrument cluster C220b-17, circuit 1851 (WH/LG) and engine diagnostic connector C2173-C, circuit 1851 (WH/LG); and measure the resistance between instrument cluster C220b-16, circuit 1852 (PK/LG) and engine diagnostic C2173-D, circuit 1852 (PK/LG).

Measure the resistance between instrument cluster C220b-15, circuit 1814 (WH/LB) and DLC C251-6, circuit 1814 (WH/LB); and measure the resistance between instrument cluster C220b-14, circuit 1815 (PK/LB) and DLC C251-14, circuit 1815 (PK/LB).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms for all measurements?

entry.para: REPAIR the high resistance in the diagnostic link. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: B7 CHECK FOR CORRECT MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Connect all the module connectors and make sure they seat correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new module. Follow the manufacturer's instructions. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. CLEAR the diagnostic trouble codes (DTCs). REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test C: No Module/Network Communication - No Power To The Diagnostic Tool At The DLC

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, the diagnostic tool is connected to the DLC C251 to communicate with the CAN J2284 network. If communication cannot be established, the diagnostic tool and DLC C251 must be checked for damage. If the diagnostic tool and DLC C251 are OK, power distribution center fuse 31 (10A) and circuit 391 (RD/YE) must be checked for voltage and 57 (BK) must be checked for an open condition.

item.para: Worn or damaged DLC diagnostic connector C251

table.title: PINPOINT TEST C: NO MODULE/NETWORK COMMUNICATION - NO POWER TO THE DIAGNOSTIC TOOL AT THE DLC

para.emph: C1 CHECK DLC C251 FOR DAMAGE

item.para: Inspect the DLC C251 pins for damage.

entry.para: REPAIR DLC C251. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C2 CHECK THE VOLTAGE TO THE DLC C251 PIN 16, CIRCUIT 391 (RD/YE)

item.para: Measure the voltage to the DLC C251-16, circuit 391 (RD/YE).

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: VERIFY the power distribution center (PDC) fuse 31 (10A) is OK. If OK, REPAIR circuit 391 (RD/YE). TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: C3 CHECK THE DLC GROUNDS - CIRCUIT 57 (BK)

item.para: Measure the resistance to ground at DLC C251-4, circuit 57 (BK), and DLC C251-5, circuit 57 (BK).

para.emph: Are the resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: CHECK the diagnostic tool. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 57 (BK). TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test D: No Module/Network Communication - No Power To The Diagnostic Tool At The Deutsch Diagnostic Connector

svcsubproc.para: Under normal operation, the diagnostic tool is connected to the Deutsch connector to communicate with the CAN J1939 and ATA J1708 networks. If communication cannot be established, the diagnostic tool and Deutsch connector C2173 must be checked for damage. If the diagnostic tool and C2173 are OK, power distribution center fuse 31 (10A) and circuit 391 (RD/YE) must be checked for voltage and 57 (BK) must be checked for an open condition.

item.para: Worn or damaged Deutsch diagnostic connector C2173

table.title: PINPOINT TEST D: NO MODULE/NETWORK COMMUNICATION - NO POWER TO THE DIAGNOSTIC TOOL AT THE DEUTSCH DIAGNOSTIC CONNECTOR

para.emph: D1 CHECK THE DEUTSCH DIAGNOSTIC CONNECTOR C2173 FOR DAMAGE

item.para: Inspect the engine diagnostic connector C2173 pins for damage.

entry.para: REPAIR engine diagnostic connector C2173. TEST the system for normal operation.

item.para: Measure the voltage at engine diagnostic connector C2173-B, circuit 391 (RD/YE).

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: VERIFY the power distribution center (PDC) is OK. If OK, REPAIR circuit 391 (RD/YE). TEST the system for normal operation.

item.para: Measure the resistance to ground at engine diagnostic connector C2173-A, circuit 57 (BK).

para.emph: Is the resistance less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: CHECK the diagnostic tool. TEST the system for normal operation.
REPAIR circuit 57 (BK). TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: Pinpoint Test E: No Module/Network Communication - IDM, ECM, EGR Drive Module CAN2 Network Error

svcsubproc.para: The CAN2 link is a private communication link used only between the ECM, IDM and EGR drive module. There is no relation to the CAN J1939 link that is used for communication with various processors on a vehicle. The CAN2 network consists of circuit 69 and circuit 70. If one of these bus wires becomes open, shorted to ground or voltage, CAN2 network communication is no longer possible and may result in a no-start condition for the vehicle.

item.para: Circuit 69 or 70 open, shorted to ground or shorted to power

table.title: PINPOINT TEST E: NO MODULE/NETWORK COMMUNICATION - IDM, ECM, EGR DRIVE MODULE CAN2 NETWORK ERROR

para.emph: E1 CHECK FOR A NO-START CONDITION
E2 CHECK FOR AN OPEN IN CIRCUIT 69 OR 70

item.para: Measure the resistance between EGR drive module C1450-3, circuit 69 and ECM C175d-6, circuit 69.
Measure the resistance between EGR drive module C1450-4, circuit 70 and ECM C175d-13, circuit 70.

para.emph: Are both resistances less than 5 ohms?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: E3 CHECK FOR CORRECT MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Inspect the EGR drive module C1450.
Connect EGR drive module C1450 and make sure it is seated correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new EGR drive module. Follow the manufacturer's instructions. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. CLEAR the diagnostic trouble codes (DTCs). REPEAT the self-test.

para.emph: E4 CHECK CIRCUIT 69 AND 70 FOR A SHORT TO BATTERY

item.para: Measure the voltage at ECM C175d-6, circuit 69 and ECM C175d-13, circuit 70.

para.emph: Is battery voltage present on either circuit?
E5 VERIFY THE EGR DRIVE MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Measure the voltage at ECM C175d-6, circuit 69 and ECM C175d-13, circuit 70.

para.emph: Is battery voltage present on either circuit?

entry.para: INSTALL a new EGR drive module. Follow the manufacturer's instructions. TEST the system for normal operation.

item.para: Measure the voltage at ECM C175d-6, circuit 69 and ECM C175d-13, circuit 70.

para.emph: Is battery voltage present on either circuit?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.
INSTALL a new IDM drive module. Follow the manufacturer's instructions. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: E7 CHECK CIRCUIT 69 AND 70 FOR A SHORT TO GROUND

item.para: Measure the resistance between ECM C175d-6, circuit 69 and ECM C175d-13, circuit 70.

para.emph: Is less than 10,000 ohms resistance to ground present on either circuit?
E8 VERIFY THE EGR DRIVE MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Measure the resistance to ground at ECM C175d-6, circuit 69 and ECM C175d-13, circuit 70.

para.emph: Is less than 10,000 ohms resistance to ground present on either circuit?

entry.para: INSTALL a new EGR drive module. Follow the manufacturer's instructions. TEST the system for normal operation.

item.para: Measure the resistance to ground at ECM C175d-6, circuit 69 and ECM C175d-13, circuit 70.

para.emph: Is less than 10,000 ohms resistance to ground present on either circuit?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.
INSTALL a new IDM drive module. Follow the manufacturer's instructions. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: E10 CHECK CIRCUIT 69 AND 70 FOR AN OPEN CIRCUIT

item.para: Measure the resistance between ECM C175d-6, circuit 69 and IDM C1174c-30, circuit 69.
Measure the resistance between ECM C175d-13, circuit 70and IDM C1174c-31, circuit 70.

para.emph: Is resistance less than 5 ohms on both measurements?

entry.para: REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: E11 CHECK CIRCUIT 1832 (DB/LG) FOR AN OPEN CIRCUIT

item.para: Measure the voltage between IDM C1450-1, circuit 1832 (DB/LG) and ground.

para.emph: Is the voltage greater than 10 volts?

entry.para: VERIFY the power distribution center (PDC) fuse 41 (10A) is OK. If OK, REPAIR the circuit. TEST the system for normal operation.

para.emph: E12 CHECK FOR CORRECT MODULE OPERATION

item.para: Inspect the IDM C1174c and ECM C175d.
Connect IDM C1174c and ECM C175d and make sure they are seated correctly.
Operate the system and verify the concern is still present.

entry.para: INSTALL a new IDM module. Follow the manufacturer's instructions. TEST the system for normal operation.
The system is operating correctly at this time. The concern may have been caused by a loose or corroded connector. CLEAR the diagnostic trouble codes (DTCs). REPEAT the self-test.
